source.name: Lab 2.1: Exploring the actions  folder - custom action reasoning
source.instructions: **Why is `action_bank_hours` implemented as a custom action rather than a simple `utter_*` response in the domain?**

answers.answer: Responses can't send messages to users
The message changes based on the current day (Saturday, Sunday, weekday)â€”that requires Python logic and `datetime`
Actions are required for all bank-related messages

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT explain why dynamic content requires a custom action instead of a simple response
source.guidance: Custom actions are needed when the response requires dynamic content or conditional logic. In this case, the `action_bank_hours` needs to check what day of the week it is using the `datetime` module and then respond with different bank hours depending on whether it's a weekday, Saturday, or Sunday. A simple `utter_*` response can only provide static text and doesn't have access to Python logic or the ability to determine the current date/time.
